result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary A. VANDERLINDEN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

State moves to dismiss and read in both counts.  The defendant plead to a charge of 3rd degree sexual assault in 15 CF 388.  Motion granted.
$500.00 cash bail is ordered transferred to 15 CF 388 and held until sentencing.
Minutes.

Defendant's bail is amended from $1,000.00 to $500.00. All other conditions remain the same.

Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
$500.00 cash bail furnished at 4:21 p.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
ARRAIGNMENT
Information filed.  Not guilty plea(s).  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-10-15 at 10:00 a.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL
Parties stipulate to a lower bond amount of $500.00 with the same conditions.  Motion granted.  Attorney Snavely is directed to prepare the Order.
Minutes.
for Bail Modification.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 11-18-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.
RE:  Bail jumping, between 10-23-15 and 10-25-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of use of computer to facilitate sex crime and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-09-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, have no contact with C.M.H., DOB: 12-09-2003 or anyone under the age of 18, no use or possession of any internet enabled device and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
